intro: Caucaea dodsoniana, commonly known as the Dodson's caucaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale pink. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
